admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
theme: Other financial and private sector development,Rural services and infrastructure

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Highway Maintenance
            Project for Estonia were as follows: Bank performance was
            satisfactory; and Borrower performance was highly
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: surface
            dressings are an excellent way to treat some types of
            pavement problems at low cost, but require special care in
            their application. During project preparation, the Estonia
            Road Administration (ERA) planned to purchase all of the
            bitumen and aggregate in bulk in order to assure adequate
            quality and to get what it assumed will be a better price
            than if each contractor bought his own materials. In the
            initial stages of project planning, the ERA thought that it
            will be necessary to procure equipment for the privatized
            firms that will be bidding on the civil works component,
            since most of the equipment in the country was old and not
            of good quality. This project demonstrated that road
            maintenance costs can be carried out at levels considerable
            lower than thought by other country road maintenance
            organizations, some other lending institutions, some
            consultants, and other parts of the Bank. Frequent visits to
            Finland, the presence of Finnish highway engineers during
            contract supervision, the constant exchange of information,
            and the access to Finnish used road construction equipment
            at favorable prices all contributed to the establishment of
            a relationship that will no doubt extend well beyond the
            life of the project.
